# Formatter.UnitStyle

**Enumeration**

Specifies the width of the unit, determining the textual representation.

## Declaration

```swift
enum UnitStyle
```

## Overview

The unit is represented in the shortest notation available. For example, for English, when formatting “3 pounds”: [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Formatter/UnitStyle/long] is “3 pounds”; [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Formatter/UnitStyle/medium] is “3 lb”; [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Formatter/UnitStyle/short] is “3#”.

## Constants

- **Formatter.UnitStyle.short**: Specifies a short unit style.
- **Formatter.UnitStyle.medium**: Specifies a medium unit style.
- **Formatter.UnitStyle.long**: Specifies a long unit style.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **Formatter.Context**: The formatting context for a formatter.
